intro: Cremanthodium lineare var. lineare, commonly known as the slender cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the European Alps. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in open alpine meadows. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense cluster, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
